page.title: 01THE LIE OF THE LAND
page.content:
This part of the survey is situated in the South-East corner of the Wirral Penisular and lies on gently sloping land rising for the south - west.It is situated at the very end of a shallow sandstone ridge which extends in a north - westerly direction as far as Birkenhead.
To the west of the area the land rolls gently down into an ice cut valley which extends to the north west and the Wirral coast.
The natural vegetation of this block might best be decribed as marsh with scrub,much of that made up by Silver Birch.Today it most difficult to find any remains of this as most of the area has either been aquired for houses or is now intensively farmed.
